page.title: 13SOCIAL CONCERNS ASHBY MAGNA
page.content: The major local concern is that of land use. Newcomers to the villages are attracted by unspoiled nature and old properties. The longer standing residents are worried about ageing and reduction in size of the population and thus loss of local services. They therefore support the sale of land for housing development to see new young faces. There is however concern from some residents about loss of village character with inappropriately designed new houses amongst the old. Sale of land to the County Council also causes concern to local farmers. This raises land prices above that which small farmers are able to pay. The Council has now bought a large area around Ashby Magna. This area is also now closed to fox hunting because of Council policies.
